She has taken part in the crediting program of SEDA starting in 2012. In this first loan cycle, she wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to upgrade her business stall of fresh fruits.

Thang is 51 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to raise chickens.
Lan is 24 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to sell construction materials.
Sau is 25 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to develop her pawn service.
Huong is 26 years old. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to do carpentry work.

loans.use: to upgrade her business stall of fresh fruits.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es:
Jonathan es un joven emprendedor que desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar junto con su padre en la actividad de la fabricación de maquinaria, y gracias a todo el tiempo que tiene de experiencia ahora es reconocido por realizar trabajos de muy buena calidad, y esto le permite tener muy buenos clientes. Jonathan proviene de una familia con escasos recursos económicos y para poder que sus padres tengan una mejor calidad de vida, con su trabajo contribuye económicamente a sus padres, además, es con su trabajo que genera el dinero necesario para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar donde convive con su esposa y su hijo de 9 meses de nacido. Actualmente está elaborando una máquina remachadora pero tiene dificultades económicas para comprar la materia prima, es por esto que busca un préstamo para comprar la materia prima que requiere para la fabricación de una remachadora.

De esta manera podrá salir adelante superando la dificultad de capital y sus ingresos en el hogar no se verán afectados. Su mayor sueño es lograr tener un gran taller de fabricación de máquinas y en un futuro tener su casa propia para darle a su familia un hogar más estable.
texts.en:
Jonathan is a hardworking young man who, since very young began working with his father at the business of making machinery. Thanks to all the experience he has had, Jonathan is now well known for doing good quality work and this enables him to have good clients.

Jonathan comes from a family of scarce resources and through his work contributes economically to his parents so they will have a better quality of life. In addition, he also works to generate the money necessary to support the expenses of his own household, where he lives with his wife and their 9 month-old child.

Currently he is working on a riveting machine but he has run into economic difficulties in buying the raw materials he needs. Consequently, he is looking for a loan to purchase the supplies he needs to make the riveter. In this way he will be able to move ahead and overcome the problem of capital and his household earnings will not be affected. His greatest dream is to own a large machine factory and in the future to own his own house in order to give his family a more stable home.

loans.use: to purchase the basic materials he needs to make a riveting machine.

loans.name: Leakena

texts.en:
Leakena is 30 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. She lives in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. 

She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) is a motor taxi driver who earns about $5 each day.

 In order to improve her family’s finances, Leakena is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase piglets to breed in order to resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn more income to financially support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed in order to resell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea is 35 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. She lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Kunthea is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service. This purchase will help her husband generate additional income to financially support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is 54 years old. She has two children who are adults and have their own families. 

She sells cooked food in the market and has raised pigs for a living for 14 years. From her small business, she gains 3,800,000 VND a month. 

She has taken part in the crediting program of SEDA starting in 2012. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to enlarge her pigsty.

loans.use: to enlarge her pigsty.

loans.name: Hel

texts.en:
Hel is 42 years old. She is married and resides with six children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up cattle for more than twenty years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns about $3 each day. Two of her children are garment workers. They earn about $4 per day. 

Because the present motorbike is old, Hel is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run the taxi service. This purchase will help him attract more customers and earn more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to purchase a Tuk Tuk (a motorcycle pulling a passenger trailer or a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi) to run the taxi service, and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run the taxi service.

loans.name: Han

texts.en: Han is 57 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than twenty years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $2 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Han is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase fertilizer to resell. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her groceries store and rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to resell

loans.name: Binh

texts.en: Binh is 49 years old. She has three adult children who have their own families. She has been making noodles and raising pigs for a living for 12 years. From her small business, she gains 4,200,000 VND a month. She has taken part in SEDA's crediting program since 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to enlarge her pigsty.

loans.use: to enlarge her pigsty

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase basic staple goods and offer a greater variety of products to his customers.

loans.name: Yary

texts.en: Yary is 34 years old. She is married and blessed with one child, and lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries and food for more than seven years, earning approximately $10 daily. Her husband is employed in a hotel and earns about $2 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Yary is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more groceries to resell. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her store and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Thech

texts.en: Thech is 33 years old. She is married and blessed with one child, and lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling souvenirs for more than five years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns about $5 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Thech is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more souvenirs to resell. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more souvenirs to resell

loans.name: Sabien

texts.en: Sabien is 29 years old. She is married and blessed with one child, and lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating pepper for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. Sabien is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase a pumping machine to use for watering the pepper. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a pumping machine to use for watering her pepper

loans.name: Cristian Danilo

texts.es:
Cristian es un joven emprendedor de 20 años de edad que desde hace 8 meses comenzó su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir con el ánimo de conseguir los recursos económicos para pagar sus estudios universitarios. Debido a que proviene de una familia con escasos recursos económicos, se vio obligado a tener que trabajar para poder hacerse sus propios ingresos, y de esta manera espera poder tener el dinero suficiente para pagar su universidad. Gracias a que conoce muchas personas entre vecinos, familiares y amigos, sus ventas han logrado ser muy buenas, pero debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital no puede responder a pedidos que superen su capacidad económica para surtir el negocio. Es por esto que busca un préstamo para comprar ropa y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y algún día tener su propio local para ofrecer la ropa. Además, sueña con ofrecerle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida y poderse pagar los estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Cristian is a hardworking 20 year-old young man who started his business selling clothing 8 months ago,  with the goal of obtaining the resources to pay for his university studies. Since he comes from a family of limited economic means, he was obligated to find work so that he will be able to earn his own income and in this way hope to be able to save enough money to pay the university. 

Thanks to the fact that he knows a lot of people, his neighbors, relatives and friends, Cristian’s sales have been very good. Nevertheless, because he does not have much capital he is not able to fulfill orders that overwhelm his economic capacity to stock his business. Consequently, he is looking for a loan to purchase clothing and fill the large orders he has from his customers.

Cristian’s greatest dream is for his business to succeed and someday to own his own place where he can sell clothing. As well, he dreams of providing his parents a better quality of life and of being able to pay for his university studies.

loans.use: to buy clothing and fill the large purchase orders placed by his customers.

loans.name: Voeurn

texts.en: Voeurn is 42 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rubber plant for more than ten years, earning approximately $30 per day. Her husband (who is also in the picture) helps her run the business. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Voeurn is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more farmland in order to expand her rubber plantation. By doing so, she would earn more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her house to make it bigger and much stronger to provide better living conditions for her family, and to send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase farmland in order to expand her rubber plantation

loans.name: Korm

texts.en: Korm is 56 years old. She is married and resides with her five children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $2 daily. Four of her children are employed. They are garment workers and construction workers. They earn about $12 daily. In order to improve her business, Korm is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase more groceries to resell. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Sun Heng

texts.en: Sun Heng is 42 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been selling bread and noodles for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $2 each day. In order to improve her business, Sun Heng is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase utensils to use in selling noodles. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase utensils to use in her noodle store

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es:
Maria comenzó trabajando la venta de frutas junto a una amiga y luego de un tiempo la amigo tuvo que dejar el negocio y así María se encargó del negocio por completo, de esta manera puede contribuir económicamente en su hogar para que su esposo y sus 9 hijos puedan acceder a una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar. En su negocio ha tenido muy buenos clientes y esto le ha permitido que su familia cada vez pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida, pero ahora el problema que tiene en el negocio es el fuerte invierno que hace que cierre el negocio y sus ventas disminuyan considerablemente. Y aunque ha intentado colocar un techo más grande no ha logrado frenar el invierno en su negocio ya que coloca son techos de tela, cajas u otros, y para poder poner el techo adecuado no cuenta con el capital adecuado, es por esto que Maria busca un préstamo para ponerle un techo de buena calidad a su negocio y así evitar que el invierno arruine su negocio.

Su mayor sueño es seguir creciendo con su venta de frutas y así su familia tenga la oportunidad de tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria began working selling fruit with a friend and after a while her friend had to leave the business. Thus María looked after the business completely. In this way she can contribute financially to her household so that her husband and their nine children can access a better quality of life and better financial opportunities in order to progress. In her business she has had very good customers and this has allowed her family to be able to have a better quality of life each time. But now, the problem she has with her business is the strong winter that has made her close her business, and her sales have dropped considerably. And even though she has tried to put up a bigger roof, she's not managed to slow down winter at her business since she's put up roofs made of fabric, boxes, and other items, and to be able to put up a suitable roof she doesn't have the adequate capital. For this reason María is looking for a loan in order to put up a good quality roof over her business and thus avoid having winter wreck her business.

Her greatest dream is to continue increasing her fruit sales so that her family has the opportunity to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to put up a good quality roof over her business and thus avoid having winter wreck her business.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz comenzó a vender productos de uso personal desde hace 10 años buscando contribuir económicamente en su hogar ya que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar donde conviven con sus 2 hijos de 12 y 16 años de edad. Cuando comenzó con su negocio tenía muchas dificultades económicas, y ahora que ha logrado contribuir con sus ingresos la situación ha mejorado considerablemente y pueden gozar de una mejor calidad de vida. Aunque actualmente cuenta con muy buenos clientes, su mayor dificultad es la falta de capital para responder a grandes pedidos que hacen sus clientes y a menudo debe dejar de vender por esto. Buscando superar esta dificultad Beatriz busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal como lociones, cremas, accesorios, para surtir su negocio y responder a los grandes pedidos de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos brindándoles acceso a una educación de buena calidad y en un futuro el acceso a una educación universitaria. Además, también sueña con tener un local propio donde pueda ofrecer sus productos y así sus ventas se incrementen para que en su hogar puedan tener mejores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Beatriz began selling personal propducts ten years ago in an effort to contribute economically to her household.  Her husband's income was insufficient to pay the household expenses where they live with their two children, ages 12 and 16.  When she began her business, she had many financial difficulties.  Now that she has managed to contribute to their income, the situation has improved considerably and they can all enjoy a better quality of life.  Although she has many good customers, her major obstacle is a lack of capital to satisfy large orders.  At times, she has to decline a sale for this reason.  Looking to overcome this difficulty, Beatriz is requesting a loan to buy personal products such as lotions, creams, and accessories in order to supply her business and to be able to meet large orders from her customers.

Her biggest dream is to help her two children get ahead in life by offering them a high quality education and, in the future, a university education.  Beatriz also dreams of having her own store where she can sell her products and thereby increase sales so that her household can enjoy better financial opportunities.

loans.use: to buy personal products such as lotions, creams, and accessories to stock her business and fill large orders from her customers.

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Phea is 42 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for more than 20 years, earning approximately $14 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Her children are employed. They earn about $5 daily. 

Phea is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase timber to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business in order to make more money to support the family.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a new house.

loans.name: Siek Lang

texts.en:
Siek Lang is 38 years old. She is widowed and lives with her two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Siek Lang has been selling fruits for more than 10 years, earning approximately $7 daily. Her son is a mechanic who earns about $4 each day.

In order to make more profit, Siek Lang is requesting a loan of $1100 to purchase more fruits to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en:
Moeurn is 64 years old and lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is married and is blessed with one adult child. Moeurn has been selling groceries for more than two years, earning approximately $25 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $2 daily. Her adult child is a teacher who earns about $5 each day. 

Moeurn is requesting a loan of $1100 to purchase tables, chairs and a whiteboard for her adult child to run a private class. By doing so, her adult child would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs and a whiteboard for her adult child to run a private class

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng is 58 years old. She is widowed and blessed with her son, her daughter-in-law and a grandchild in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening cattle for more than 20 years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her son is a garment worker who earns about $3 each day. 

Kheng is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase fertilizer to use for her rice farming. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to use in her rice farming

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea is 27 years old. She is widowed and lives with her two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over a year, earning approximately $4 each day. 

Sothea is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase bricks and cement to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase bricks and cement to rebuild her house

loans.name: Srey Mom

texts.en:
Srey Mom is 34 years old, is married and blessed with two children. They live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling marble for more than 10 years, earning approximately $50 per day. Her husband helps her to run the business. 

Due to the difficulty of her family’s transportation expenses, Srey Mom is requesting a loan of $1100 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Sinoun

texts.en:
Sinoun is 39 years old. She is married and lives with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice for more than 20 years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband makes drums to sell. He earns about $4 each day. 

Sinoun is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en:
Choeurn is 48 years old. She is married and lives with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening animals for more than five years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is involved in fishing. He earns about $3 daily. Her children are employed. They earn about $6 per day. 

Choeurn is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a pumping machine to pump water into her rice field. In the future, she would like to build up her land with earth to prevent flooding.

loans.use: to purchase a pumping machine to pump water into her rice field

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea is 48 years old. She is married and lives with her four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker while her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver who earns about $8 each day. Her children are employed. They earn about $10 per day. 

Thea is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase cement and bricks to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and build a fence around her house.

loans.use: to purchase cement and bricks to rebuild her house

loans.name: Soch

texts.en:
Soch is 31 years old. She is married and lives with her three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than seven years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband runs a business which involves purchasing motorbikes to resell. He earns about $7 each day. 

Soch is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a secondhand motorbike to fix and resell for a profitable price. By doing so, they would earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a pond shop and help her children to earn bachelor degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorbike to fix and resell for a profitable price

loans.name: Soeury

texts.en:
Soeury is 29 years old. She is married and lives with her two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries and meat for more than three years, earning approximately $15 each day. Her husband is a tuk tuk (motorized rickshaw) taxi driver who earns about $10 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Soeury is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase groceries to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 41 years old, is married and has four children. She is presently sending her children to school and supporting their education. Arlene’s husband is working abroad as a driver in Saudi Arabia to generate income for their family.
 
With her determination to help her husband to meet their children's needs, Arlene has engaged herself in the livestock business. She raises pigs and sells each pig after four months of taking care of it. Arlene wants to maintain the business while their children are going to school. She is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her pigs. She hopes to see her children become professionals someday through her earnings from the business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her pigs.

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en:
Savoeurn is 57 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is widowed and blessed with one child. She has been selling cakes and drinks for more than four years, earning approximately $6 per day. 

Savoeurn is requesting a loan of $900 to purchase timber to build a new store for selling her cakes and drinks. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and send her grandchild to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a new store for selling her cakes and drinks

loans.name: Jacky Joy

texts.en:
A dream to succeed in business is Jacky Joy's priority. She manages a pig-raising business in their village. She has been in this type of business for five years and has been able to maintain it while she manages the business.

Jacky Joy is 29 years old, is married and has one child who attends school. Her husband works abroad as an electrician in Saudi Arabia. Jacky Joy verified that her income from the business is to use for their child's education. She wishes to maintain and extend the business to earn additional income for the family and to save some for their future. In order to attain her wish, Jacky Joy needs additional money. Hence, she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy piglets to raise.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is 40 years old. She is married and lives with her parents and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and sewing palm leaf thatches to sell for more than 10 years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs a tree-felling service. He earns about $3 daily. Three of her children are construction workers. They earn about $11 each day.

Due to the difficulty of her family’s transportation, Mao is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to send her youngest child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy has been engaged in rice production for 39 years. He aims to achieve a higher yield with every harvest of his crop. The duration of his experience in rice farming makes his strategy more effective as he applies it to his farming activities.
 
Jimmy is 55 years of age, is married to a loving wife and they are blessed with four children. His priorities in life are to send his children to school through to their completion of college. He said that education is the only treasure that he can give to his children.

Jimmy works hard, continuing to develop his farming strategy in order to attain his aim. Financial difficulty is the hindrance in attaining his aim. Thus, he is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy herbicides, pesticides and fertilizers to use on his farm. He hopes that applying these inputs will have a positive result for his rice production business.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, pesticides and fertilizers to use on his farm.

loans.name: Art

texts.en: Art is 47 years old. She is widowed and blessed with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish for more than twenty years, earning approximately $7 daily. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Art is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money from her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 28-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of building a permanent house for his residence. Francis owns an internet cafe and his main hardships are price fluctuations and limited seating for his customers. He has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming and educating his siblings. Francis needs a loan to buy modern furniture for use in his internet cafe.

loans.use: to buy modern furniture for use in his internet cafe.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen used his previous loan to buy tea to sell. With the proceeds, he was able to pay his children's school fees. Stephen's personal dream is to construct a better house for his family and also to support his children's education. 

He faces the challenges of price fluctuations and high taxes levied on his business. However, he has a business dream of buying land on which to grow his own tea. Stephen needs this loan to buy tea to sell.

loans.use: to buy tea to sell.

loans.name: Febe

texts.en:
Febe is 53 years old, married to Marcelino, and blessed with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She operates a buy-and-sell business. Particularly, she is selling fish in the village. She has patiently done this to improve their living situation.  


Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fish, Styrofoam, and a new weighing scale. She is hoping that with the help of what she has, she and her family would definitely stay away from poor living.

loans.use: to purchase fish, Styrofoam and a new weighing scale

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en: Oeurn is 25 years old. She is married and blessed with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been working in HCC for more than two years, earning approximately $2 each day. Her husband runs a souvenir shop. He earns about $8 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Oeurn is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase more souvenirs to sell to tourists. In the future, she would like to rebuild her souvenir shop to make it bigger and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more souvenirs to sell to tourists

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn, age 31, works hard to support her family. She has a piggery business. She is requesting a loan of P10,000 to purchase vitamins, feed, and two more pigs. She has been in this business for 5 years now. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save for the future of her future children. She prays for the expanding of her business through the loan in order to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feed, and two more pigs

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en: Savorn is 41 years old. He is married and resides with five children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a construction foreman for more than six years, earning approximately $8 per day. His wife is a cleaner who earns about $2 each day. Two of his children are construction workers. They earn about $10 daily. In order to improve his business, Savorn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase mortar to use in his construction work. In the future, he would like to run a metal shop and help his children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, he hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase mortar to use in his construction work

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 47-year-old hardworking married man with eight children. He is living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has a dream of educating his children up to university and buying a car. 

For 15 years, he has been operating a retail shop, and he started the business with the money he earned as a tailor. He has a business dream of owning a wholesale shop.

Godfrey wants a loan to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 38-year-old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. For four years, he has been running a hardware shop, and with the proceeds, he has been able to buy land and pay school fees for his children. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are affecting the growth of his business. He dreams of building a permanent home and educating his six children. 

Joseph wants a loan to buy iron sheets and nails to sell.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and nails to sell.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en: Sarin is 32 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately $1 per day. Her husband (who joined her in the picture) runs an electronics repair shop. He earns about $10 daily. Because her community doesn’t have electricity, Sarin is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a generator for her husband to produce electricity to use in his shop. In the future, she would like to rebuild her husband’s shop to make it bigger and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: to purchase a generator for her husband

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is 25 years old and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been selling local brew for four years after diverting from farming. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are affecting the growth of his business. He dreams of building a permanent home and educating his children. He would also like to expand his business to the capital city. Steven wants a loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 50 years and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. For 12 years, he has been operating a lodge and the business has now picked up. He has the challenges of limited finances to purchase modern equipment. His dream is to educate his children and expand his business to new places. Francis intends to use the loan to buy beds and mattresses for the lodge.

loans.use: to buy beds and mattresses for the lodge.

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en: Rorn is 45 years old. She is married and blessed with three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a construction worker. In addition, he is involved in cultivating cassava. He earns about $10 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Rorn is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase farmland to cultivate rubber plants. By doing so, she could earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to cultivate rubber plants

loans.name: Esperance Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kahindo est secrétaire du le groupement  d’affaire Esperance, elle est mariée et mère de 4 jeunes enfants. Son mari  est un fonctionnaire de la régie de voies aériennes (RVA). La cliente est vendeuse de souliers usagés dans un marché. Elle commença son business avec  le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Elle vient de réaliser 2 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 20 paires de souliers. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui  et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes
texts.en: Kahindo is secretary of the Esperance business group.  She is married and the mother of four childern.  Her husband is a civil servant at the RVA (air travel authority in the Democratic Republic of the Congo).  Kahindo sells secondhand shoes in a market.  She began her business with a loan through Hekima and has recently completed two cycles in the microcredit program.  This new loan will help her to buy 20 pairs of shoes.  She thanks Hekima for its support and for helping women entrepreneurs to gain independence.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of shoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Gladys Johanna

texts.es:
Gladys se encuentra casada y tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad, y debido a que los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, decidió montar una tienda general con la que pueda contribuir económicamente en su hogar para que la calidad de vida de su esposo y su hijo mejoren considerablemente. Debido a que montó su tienda con muy bajo capital tiene muy poca variedad de productos de la canasta familiar para ofrecer a sus clientes, y no cuenta con más capital para aumentar esta variedad. Es por esto que Gladys busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar que le permitan tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y así sus ventas aumenten considerablemente. 

Su mayor sueño es sacar este negocio adelante y que le permita brindar a las personas de su hogar mejores condiciones económicas para progresar, además de contar con una mejor calidad de vida. También sueña con brindarle a su hijo en un futuro el acceso a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Gladys is married and has a 12-year-old son, and due to the fact that her husband's income is not enough to cover household expenses, she decided to set up a general store in order to contribute economically to the household and improve her husband's and son's quality of life.  Since she set up her store with just a little capital she does not have a wide variety of products to offer customers for the family shopping basket.  And she does not have the money to increase her range.  Therefore Gladys is requesting a loan to buy the products she needs to increase her variety and sales considerably.

Her greatest dream is to make her business successful in order to provide her family with better economic conditions to get ahead and live a better lifestyle.  She also wants to give her son access to a university education.

loans.use: To buy products for the family shopping basket in order to increase variety and increase sales considerably.

loans.name: Alexandra Noreli

texts.es:
Alexandra es una joven emprendedora que se encuentra casada y tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad, y para contribuir económicamente en su hogar tiene un almacén donde ofrece productos de uso personal y productos de uso doméstico a sus clientes. Como proviene de una familia con escasos recursos económicos, su negocio lo montó con el ánimo de mejorar la situación económica de su hogar y poder contribuir con algo de dinero a sus padres para que mejoraran la calidad de vida que tenían. Posteriormente se casó y ahora su almacén sigue siendo un apoyo económico para sus padres, pero también le permite contribuir junto con su esposo para que en su hogar puedan tener una buena calidad de vida. Buscando ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes, y aprovechando una vitrina que tiene en su negocio, Alexandra busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y productos de uso doméstico para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es que su negocio le siga permitiendo ofrecer a sus padres una buena estabilidad económica y también tener en su hogar una buena calidad de vida para su esposo y su hijo.
texts.en:
Alexandra is a young entrepreneur who is married and has a 10-year-old son.  In order to contribute economically to her household, she runs a store where she sells personal care and household products.  Since she is from a family with scarce economic resources, she set up her business in order to help out at home and be able to give some money to her parents to improve their quality of life.  Now that she is married, her store still provides economic support for her parents, and also allows her to contribute, along with her husband, to her own household to have a good lifestyle.  In an effort to offer a wider variety of products to her customers, and taking advantage of the display case at her store, Alexandra is requesting a loan to buy personal care and household products to expand her range.

Her greatest dream is that through her business she can continue offering her parents economic stability, as well as also providing a good quality of life for her husband and son at home.

loans.use: To buy personal care and household products to offer more variety to her customers.

loans.name: Yanuncay  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Yanuncay está integrado por 11 socias quienes son en su mayoría, familia y amigas, ellas se dedican al comercio y a las artesanías, son personas amables, gentiles y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es visitada por su variada gastronomía, por la belleza natural y por su riqueza cultural y arquitectónica que enamora a quienes la visitan. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Jackeline del Cisne, vive por el sector de  Fátima en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 43 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 20, 13 y  11 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en la universidad, su segundo hijo en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora prestando sus servicios en un taxi que es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. Jackeline del Cisne pasa en casa y se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, también trabaja en el negocio de su suegra que es un restaurante, actividad que la desempeña hace 15 años y labora de lunes a viernes todo el día. Ella también trabaja  independiente los fines de semana, vende comida en toda clase de fiestas.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando una cocineta y una carpa para vender sus productos.
 
Su sueño es  que sus hijos sean profesionales.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Yanuncay is comprised of 11 members who are, mainly, family and friends.  They work in commerce and crafts, and are kind, gentle people who maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.  They live in a beautiful sector of the city of Cuenca, a city which is visited for its gastronomic variety, natural beauty and cultural and architectural richness, that win the heart of visitors.

One of the members of this group is Jackeline del Cisne, who lives in the Fátima neighborhood of the city of Cuenca.  She is 43, married and has three children, ages 20, 13 and 11.  Her eldest daughter studies at the university, her second son is in junior high and the youngest son goes to a school in the city.  Her husband is as professional driver and works in his own taxi business.

Jackeline del Cisne is a homemaker and takes care of the household, and also works at her mother-in-law's restaurant, where she has been for 15 years, working Monday through Friday, all day.  She also works independently on weekends, selling food for all kinds of parties.

The member has been in the communal bank for two years and her new loan will be used to buy a cooker and tent to sell her products.

Her dream is that her children become professionals.

The small picture is of a member who was not present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy a cooker and a tent.

loans.name: Mujer Y Fortaleza  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza está formado por 16 socias, quienes viven por los alrededores de la Parroquia de Turi en Cuenca,  desde esta parroquia hay una hermosa vista de una gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca por lo que es conocida también como el mirador de la ciudad. Su gente al igual que nuestras socias se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes plazas de trabajos, son personas amables, gentiles y de un corazón cálido, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ana Beatriz, tiene 37 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 16, 15, 13 y 11 años de edad, todos sus hijos  estudian en la escuela por ser niños especiales. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción y la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Ana Beatriz pasa el mayor de su tiempo en casa al cuidado de sus hijos, pero para apoyarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la agricultura, siembra verduras las mismas que las vende en su casa. También cría y vende son pollos y cuyes.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y todos los créditos le han beneficiado en su trabajo, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para la cría.
 
Su sueño es tener una panadería ya que sabe de este arte.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujer y Fortaleza is comprised of 16 members who live in the Turi Parish in Cuenca.  From this parish there is a beautiful view of most of the city of Cuenca, so it is known as the city viewpoint.  Its people, just like our members, are involved in commerce, livestock farming and work in different areas in the city.  They are kind, gentle, warm-hearted people, who maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

One of the members of this group is Ana Beatriz, who is 37, married and has four children, ages 16, 15, 13 and 11.  All of her children study at the school for special children.  Her husband is a construction worker and the house they live in belongs to them.

Ana Beatriz spends most of her time at home taking care of her children, but she supports her husband with the household expenses and works in farming, growing vegetables that she sells from home.  She also raises chickens and guinea pigs.

The member has been in the communal bank for three years and all of the loans have helped her work.  The new loan will be used to buy chickens to raise.

Her dream is to have a bakery one day because she knows trade.

The small picture is of a member who could not be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Pacha  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Paccha está formado por 5 socias y 1 socio, quienes viven por los alrededores del Cantón Nabon, lugar que tiene una geografía muy accidentada, su clima es frió, su extensa vegetación nos regalan paisajes para relajarse fuera del ruido de la ciudad. Su gente es amable, gentil, tienen un corazón cálido y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, la  mayor parte de su gente se dedican a laborar en la agricultura, cría de animales y muchos salen diariamente a laborar en la ciudad en donde ejercen varias actividades las que le permiten mejorar su estabilidad económica.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. Ligia, tiene 21 años de edad y es madre soltera de un hijo de 3 años, vive en casa de sus padres quienes se dedican a la ganadería, la casa en la que viven es propiedad de sus padres.

Doña Ligia se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura sembrando hortalizas y verduras, su cosecha la vende, también cría y vende cuyes, cerdos, borregos y pollos, tiene ganado y la leche que obtiene de su ganado la vende y también realiza quesillo para la venta. Hace dos meses puso una tiendita con panadería, el pan lo realiza nuestra socia ya que aprendiendo este arte en cursos.
 
Este es el primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga, su crédito lo va a invertir comprando abono para sus potreros.

Su meta es  comprar vacas de mejor calidad para que den más leche.
texts.en:
The communal bank Paccha is comprised of five women and one man who live in the Nabon Canton, a mountainous area with a cold climate.  Its extensive vegetation gives us a countryside to relax in, away from the noise of the city.  Its people are kind, gentle and warm-hearted and maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.  Most of the people work in agriculture and livestock farming, and many go out daily to work in the city where they carry out different business activities to improve their economic stability.

One of the members of this group is Ligia, who is 21 and a single mother of a three-year-old boy.  She lives with her parents who are livestock farmers.  The house belongs to her parents.

Ligia is a farmer and grows vegetables that she sells.  She also raises and sells guinea pigs, pigs, sheep and chickens.  She has cattle and also sells the milk she obtains as well as cheese that she makes.  Two months ago she opened a store with a bakery, making the bread herself since she took a baking course.

This is her first loan through the communal bank, which she was invited to join by a friend.  She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her crops.

Her goal is to buy better quality cows to increase her milk production.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Nuevo Porvenir  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir está formado por 13 socias quienes son mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras, amables y de un corazón muy cálido, trabajan en actividades  del campo como es la agricultura y cría de animales, también se dedican al comercio y muchos laboran en la ciudad, se caracterizan por mantener la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. La parroquia de Cumbe se encuentra situada al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, es de clima frió, tiene una geografía accidenta la cual da espacio a grandes llanuras propicias para la ganadería y también sus montañas nos brindan hermosos paisajes para relajarse admirando la naturaleza.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Dolores, tiene 42 año, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, una hija es casada y vive independiente, dos hijos estudian en un colegio a distancia y también trabajan, tres de sus hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad y su ultima hija pasa en casa ya que apenas tiene 3 años de edad. Su esposo es albañil, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña María pasa la mayor de su tiempo en casa al cuidado de su familia y para aportar a la economía de su hogar trabaja cultivando sus tierras, sus cosechas para la venta y consumo de su hogar, también cría y vende pollos, cerdos y cuyes, tiene ganado y la leche que obtiene entrega a los carros lecheros.
 
Se encuentra en el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para los mismos.

Su meta es seguir agrandando su criadero de animales.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nuevo Porvenir is comprised of 13 members who are hard-working, determined, kind, warm-hearted women who work in agriculture and livestock farming.  They also work in commerce, many work throughout the city.  They are known for maintaining the culture and traditions of their villages.  The parish of Cumbe is located southeast  of the city of Cuenca.  It has a cold climate and uneven geography, with large plains perfect for livestock and mountains that give us a beautiful countryside to relax in and admire nature.

One of the members of this group is María Dolores who is 42, married and has seven children.  One of her daughters is married and lives independently.  Two of her children study at a school that is far away and they also work.  Three of her children go to the local school and her youngest daughter is still at home since she just turned three.  Her husband is a bricklayer and the house they live in is their own.

María spends most of her time at home taking care of the family.  But to contribute to the household economy she works the land and grows crops that she both sells and uses for home consumption.  She also raises and sells chickens, pigs and guinea pigs, and has cows that give her milk to sell to milk collectors.

This is her third loan through the communal bank and she plans to use it to buy chickens and chicken feed.

Her goal is to keep expanding her livestock activity.

loans.use: To buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Primero De Enero  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Primero de Enero está formado por 7 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por la parroquia del Valle que se encuentra a 5 km de la ciudad de Cuenca, es de clima frió, tiene varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza como es la colina de Tasqui desde donde se puede ver la parroquia y la ciudad de Cuenca. Su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales, al comercio y muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades económicas, las que le permiten mejorar la situación económica de sus hogares. Nuestras socias son mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras de un corazón cálido, su mayor virtud es que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. María Eulalia,  tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su papá es albañil y su mamá trabaja como empleada domestica, la casa en la que habitan es  propiedad de un familiar.
 
La Señorita. María Eulalia se dedica la cría y venta de pollos y cuyes, también labora en la tienda que tiene su abuelita y se encuentra hace algunos años realizando esta actividad. 

Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para surtir la tienda de su abuelita para tener mayor variedad.

Su meta es de llegar a culminar sus estudios universitarios ya que se encontraba siguiendo la carrera de Administración de Empresas pero por motivos económicos no ha podido continuar estudiando. 

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Primero de Enero is comprised of seven women and one man who live in the Valle Parish which is located five kilometers from the city of Cuenca.  Its people work in agriculture, livestock farming and commerce, and many work throughout the city in different business activities in order to improve the economic situation of their households.  Our members are hard-working, warm-hearted entrpreneurs, whose greatest virtue is that they still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

One of the members of the group is María Eulalia, 21 and single, who lives with her parents.  Her father is a bricklayer and her mother works as a domestic employee.  The house they live in is their own.

María Eulalia raises and sells chickens and guinea pigs.  She also works at her grandmother's store, where she has been working for a few years.

This is her second loan through the communal bank and she plans to use it to stock her grandmother's store so there will be more variety.

Her goal is to finish her university education, as she was studying Business Administration but due to economic reasons was unable to continue.

The small picture is of a member who could not be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
La señora Edit Magdalena  es parte de las 14 socias que forman el Banco Comunal El Señor De Los Milagros que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ella tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad y aun viven con ella, la menor estudia en Universidad. Su marido es comerciante.  Ella nos cuenta que los miembros de este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, prestación de servicios entre otras actividades. 

Nuestra amiga para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos poder ayudar a su hija con los gastos de su educación se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, nos comenta que tres días de la semana sale a ofrecer sus productos por toda su localidad, también su hija le ayuda con sus ventas pues ella vende  en la universidad donde estudia, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Tiene más de seis años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. Lo que más vende son los perfumes, además dice que ella aprovecha cuando hay ofertas ya que allí compra más barato y esto después los vende al precio normal con lo cual le queda más ganancias.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar perfumes, cosméticos, cremas y bisutería sobre todo los productos de oferta. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten comprar sus productos y así ganarse la vida honradamente.
 
Su sueño es ver que su hija termine  sus estudios y sea una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Edit Magdalena is one of the 14 members who form the communal bank El Señor de los Milagros which meets every fifteen days in the Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo.  She is 51, married and has four adult children who still live at home, with the youngest studying at the university.  Her husband is a merchant.  She tells us that the members of this group are involved in different activities such as general commerce and services.

In order to generate her own income and help pay for her daughter's education, our friend sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories).  She goes door to door three days a week to offer her products throughout the town; and her daughter also helps with sales when she can, selling at the university where she studies.  She delivers the products on a credit basis and collects payment weekly.  For over six years she has been involved in this business and it is going well.  Her best-selling product is perfume and she says she takes advantage of special offers to buy more economically and then sells at the normal price, to earn more profit.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, cosmetics, creams and costume jewelry, especially products on offer.  She has been a member of the communal bank since the beginning; and she likes it because the loans allow her to buy products and earn an honest living.

Her dream is for her daughter to finish her education and become a good professional.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazòn Del Junco  (Bahía De Caraquez) Group

texts.es:
En un sitio llamado el Junco de la ciudad de Bahía de Caraquez, se reúne cada 15 días el Banco Comunal Sagrado Corazón del Junco. 

La señora Rosa Ines es parte de las 21 socias que forman este Banco Comunal, las mismas que se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales en su gran mayoría. Ellas están repitiendo el crédito con la institución ya que es así como ellas sacan adelante sus pequeños negocios que tienen, nos cuenta que el crédito anterior les sirvió de mucho ya que con lo fuerte del invierno les sirvió para poder sacar adelante algunas sus cosechas ya que la mayoría son del campo y es para eso que utilizaron el crédito y gracias a él salieron adelante.

La señora rosa Ines tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y tienen 4 hijos dos mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 15 años que aun estudian en colegio y que son los que aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Nuestra amiga está realizando el crédito para ella y su  esposo, nos cuenta que mientras ella se dedica a la cría de gallinas y chanchos su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y venta de los productos que la tierra les ofrece, es así como ellos han podido salir delante de una forma honrada, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que su esposo tiene cultivos de maíz, maní y d verduras las mismas que son las que saca a vender cada vez que puede ya que la cosecha de maíz y maní tiene que guardarla durante un tiempo para poder vender a mejor precio. Es por eso que necesita el crédito para pagar la mano de obra en la recolección de los cultivos.

Este crédito es para pagar mano de obra en la recolección de los cultivos y para alimento para los animalitos que nuestra amiga cría, esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe de la institución.
 
Sus sueños son tener buena salud ella y su familia y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In a place called Junco, in the city of Bahía de Caraquez, the communal bank Sagrado Corazón del Junco meets every fifteen days.

Rosa is one of the 21 members who form this communal bank and work mainly in agriculture and livestock farming.  They are taking out another loan through the institution since this is how they are able to advance in their small businesses.  The previous loan was very useful because during the harsh winter they were able to grow their crops, most of them being farmers, and the loan helped them prosper.

Rosa is 48, married and has four children, two of which are adults and another two, ages 17 and 15, who are still in school and live at home.  Her husband is a farmer.

Our friend is taking out a loan for herself and her husband.  She says that while she raises chickens and pigs, her husband grows crops and sells his land's produce.  This is how they have been able to earn an honest living.  Our friend says her husband grows corn, peanuts and vegetables, which he sells when he can, since the corn and peanuts have to be stored until they can be sold at a better price.  The loan is necessary to hire workers for crop harvest.

This loan is to hire workers for the harvest and to buy animal feed.  Our friend has been in the communal bank since it began and she likes the help she receives from the institution.

Her dream is for her and the family to be healthy and prosper.

loans.use: To hire workers and buy animal feed.

loans.name: Marta Liria

texts.es:
Marta se encuentra casada y tiene un hijo de 12 años de edad, y para contribuir económicamente en su hogar, tiene en un corral en su casa una cría de cerdos que le brinda unos ingresos para su hogar. Desde muy joven aprendió la actividad gracias a que su familia siempre ha vivido en el campo y se dedicaba a estas y otras actividades, y con la experiencia de tantos años ahora tiene conocimientos de la crianza, la vacunación, atiende los partos de sus cerdos y otros cuidados más. Además es muy reconocida por criar cerdos con un gran peso que los hacen más atractivos para la venta y esto le ha permitido tener muy buenos clientes para su negocio. Marta tiene dificultades económicas en estos momentos y es por esto que busca que un préstamo le ayude para comprar el concentrado para engordar los cerdos recién nacidos y poderlos vender más grandes con un buen peso y a un buen precio a sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es darle una educación de buena calidad a su hijo y en su negocio sueña con tenerlo tecnificado y con la capacidad para criar una gran cantidad de cerdos.
texts.en:
Marta is married and has a 12-year-old son.  To contribute to the household economy she has a barnyard behind her house where she raises pigs to earn extra income.  From a very early age she learned the trade from her family which has always lived in the country and been involved in this and other business activities.  With so many years of experience, she now has knowledge about livestock farming, vaccination, birthing piglets, etc.  And she is well-known for raising very heavy pigs which makes them more attractive to sell and this has given her a good customer base for her business.  Marta is having economic hardship right now, so she is seeking a loan to help buy concentrated animal feed for the newborn piglets so they can grow bigger and command a better price.

Her greatest dream is to give her son a good education and to have a technical business with a capacity to raise more pigs.

loans.use: To buy concentrated feed for the newborn piglets so they can grow bigger and be sold for a good price.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 46 years old, married with six children, and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. Her dream is to educate her children up to university level. She has been operating a retail shop for 15 years, and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees and renovate her house. She has a business dream of owning a retail shop.

Grace wants a loan to buy sugar, soap, and clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Srey Mao

texts.en:
Srey Mao, 22, is married and lives with her parents in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating cassava for more than two years, earning approximately $24 per day. Her husband helps her run the business.

Srey Mao is requesting a loan of $1,000 to pay her passport expenses. This money will help her to work in Thailand legally. In the future, she would like to build a new house to live separately from her parents.

loans.use: to pay her passport expenses.

loans.name: Maria Adela

texts.es:
Maria es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 4 hijos desde que su esposo murió y quedó a cargo de todas las responsabilidades del hogar. Fue en búsqueda de las oportunidades económicas para brindarles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida que consiguió un local y allí montó una tienda general donde puede tener una gran cantidad de clientes gracias a la buena ubicación y así tener los ingresos que requieren en su hogar sus 4 hijos. Siempre ha tenido dificultades económicas desde que quedó a cargo de su hogar, pero con mucho esfuerzo ha venido superándolas poco a poco y continúa luchando para seguir progresando junto con sus hijos. Debido a que en su negocio tiene un problema con el invierno y requiere de reparar una carpa, Maria busca un préstamo para reparar la carpa de su negocio y poder resguardar su negocio del fuerte invierno.

De esta manera su negocio tendrá mejor presentación y más comodidad para sus clientes, permitiendo que así sus ventas aumenten y por ende los ingresos para el hogar. Su sueño es seguir aumentando la cantidad de productos que ofrece en su negocio para que sus ventas se sigan incrementando y anhela que en un futuro sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria has been a single mother head of household with her four children since her husband died and she took over all of the household responsibilities. She went in search of financial opportunities to offer her children a good quality of life. She obtained a locale and there opened a general store where she can have a lot of customers thanks to the good location. This way, she has the income she needs for her 4 children. She has always had financial difficulties since she was left alone in charge of the home, but with a lot of hard work she has overcome them little by little and she is still fighting to progress with her children. Due to the fact that her business has a problem with winter, she needs to repair an awning. Maria is sekking a loan to repair the awning of her business and be able to safekeep her business for the winter.

This way, her business will have better presentation and more comfort for her customers. This will allow her sales to increase and thus her household income. Her dream is to keep growing the quantity of products she offers in her business so her sales keep increasing and she yearns for a better quality of life for her children in the future.

loans.use: to repair the awning on her business and to safeguard her business for the winter.

loans.name: Bibiana Yaneth

texts.es:
Bibiana es una joven emprendedora que ha tenido el coraje para salir adelante a pesar de la dificultad de ser madre soltera cabeza de familia de sus 2 hijos de 5 y 13 años de edad. Desde muy joven vendía en el colegio dulces y otras mercancías con las que se generaba los ingresos para su propio transporte y sus pequeños gastos, y fue así como comenzó con la habilidad para las ventas. Ahora que requiere de unos ingresos para poder ofrecer a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida, Bibiana aprovecha esta habilidad y la pone en práctica en su negocio de venta de ropa con el que logra generar los ingresos que requiere en su hogar para que tengan una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar. Debido a que no cuenta con un capital que le permita sostener los grandes pedidos de sus clientes, Bibiana busca un préstamo para comprar ropa para responder a unos grandes pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y en un futuro abrir un almacén donde ofrezca su ropa y así además de tener mejores ventas, también pueda generar empleo para las madres solteras cabezas de familia como ella.
texts.en:
Bibiana is a young entrepreneur who has had the courage to get ahead despite the difficulty of being a single mother head of household with two children, aged 5 and 13. Since she was very young, she would sell candies at school and other merchandise to generate income for her transportation and small expenses. That was how she started with her sales ability. Now she needs some income to be able to offer her children a good quality of life. Bibiana is taking advantage of her ability and putting it into use by selling clothes to generate income she needs for her home to have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to get ahead. Since she doesn't have the capital she needs to support her customers' big orders, Bibiana is seeking a loan to buy clothes to respond to some big orders that she has from her customers.

Her biggest dream is to grow her business and in the future open a store where she can offer her clothes and also have more sales. She also wants to generate employment for single mother heads of household like her.

loans.use: to buy clothes to respond to some big orders she has from her customers.

loans.name: Elise Carine

texts.fr: Elise est une jeune femme de 29 ans célibataire, mère d'un enfant âgé de 3 mois. Après sa formation, elle ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'elle gère depuis deux ans déjà. Elle a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, mèches, et greffes dans son institut parce qu'elle achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de son enfant, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future.
texts.en: Elise is a young woman of 29 who is single with child of three months. After her training, she opened a hairdressing salon that she has been running for two years. She frequently finds herself in difficulty in her salon due to a lack of cosmetics, locks of hair and hair grafts because she buys her products retail. Her aim is to satisfy her clientele and make a large profit. She requests a credit in order to be able to buy her material wholesale which will enable her to reach her goals. The profit that she will earn from this loan will help her satisfy her needs, those of her child, and also to save to enlarge her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of locks and small hairdressing material.

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en:
Hoeurn, 39, is married and lives with her five children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband, who is shown in the picture, runs a business buying cattle for resale, earning about $6 daily. One of Hoeurn's children is employed in a rubber plantation, earning about $3 per day.

In order to improve her family’s finances, Hoeurn is requesting a loan of $900 to purchase cattle to resell. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn Bachelors degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to resale.

loans.name: Jeanne D'arc Marie

texts.fr: Jeanne D'arc est une femme de 52 ans célibataire, mère d'un enfant de 4 ans qui va déjà à l'école. Elle est commerçante depuis 4 ans dans la capitale où elle vend le carburant en détail dans les bouteilles d'un litre. c'est grâce à ce petit commerce qu'elle prend soin d'elle et de sa petite famille. Elle aimerai augmenter le montant de son capital pouvoir acheter plusieurs bidons de carburant cela lui permettra de réaliser un plus gros bénéfice qu'elle économisera pour ouvrir une petite boutique, et s'occuper de son fils.
texts.en: Jeanne D'arc is a 52 year old spinster with a child of four who goes to school. She has been a sales woman for four years in the capital where she sells small quantities of fuel in one litre bottles. Thanks to this small business she provides for herself and her little family. She would like to increase her capital in order to buy several cans of fuel. This would enable her to make a bigger profit which in turn she would save in order to open a little shop and take care of her son.

loans.use: To buy cans of fuel.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Pheap, 47, is married and lives with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than four years, earning approximately $3 per day. Three of her children are employed in the garment factory as well and they earn about $9 daily. Pheap is requesting a loan of $850 to purchase construction materials to build a toilet and a kitchen. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and help her children earn higher educations.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a toilet and a kitchen.

loans.name: Rong

texts.en: Rong, 28, is a widower living in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day. Due to transportation difficulties, Rong is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help him go to work on time and reduce his transportation expenses. In the future, he would like to be a construction foreman.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna is 50 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. She and her family live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling natural medicine for more than two years, earning approximately $3 a day. One of her children is a ceiling maker who earns about $4 a day. 

Due to the difficulties surrounding her family’s transportation needs, Vanna is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. 

In the future, Vanna would like to breed pigs to sell and rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Soung, 66, is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is a village leader who earns about $1 per day. His wife is a rice farmer who earns about $2 daily. His children are employed and they earn about $10 daily.

Due to difficulties with his family’s transportation, Soung is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable him to use the money saved on his transportation expenses to support his family. In the future, he would like to rebuild his house to make it more comfortable for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is 58 years old and married with four children. Leonardo has operated a rice-farming business in his village for 35 years. 

Leonardo is finding it difficult to pay for his farming needs such as fertilizers and herbicides. In order to pay for his farming needs, Leonardo borrowed additional capital from traders with his product serving as his payment to them.

Leonardo would like to borrow additional capital of PHP 50,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and herbicides. He says that, because of the loan, he will no longer need to ask for additional capital from the traders.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and herbicides.

loans.name: Costance

texts.en:
Constance is a 47-year-old, hardworking woman who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. She is a teacher and has been teaching for the last 23 years. She says that teaching has always been her passion and every time her students graduate she feels satisfied.

Constance dreams of educating her five children and starting a business since she is nearing retirement age. Constance wants a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 35-year-old, hardworking man with four children who lives in Hioma, Uganda. He owns a produce business, which he has been operating for eight years now. He faces challenges such as high price fluctuations and inadequate capital.

Stephen's goals are to educate his children and expand his business to new markets. Stephen intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Srey Khim

texts.en:
Srey Khim is 34 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for more than two years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband sells charcoal. He earns about $10 each day. 

Srey Khim is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland.

loans.name: Amigas Con Proyectos Especiales Group
